com.amazon.insights
Interface UserProfile

public interface UserProfile

UserProfile is used to define dimensions (or characteristics) about the current user. These dimensions are used when allocating variations so that only a specific segment of users participate in the experiment. Users not in the experiment segment receive the Control variation, but their actions do not influence any A/B view or conversions.

UserProfile Example

The example below demonstrates how to define dimensions about the current user. These dimensions are completely developer driven and can be any values you wish to "tag" about a user. It is up to you to determine how these dimensions are obtained. For example, maybe you have a User Preferences Dialog that allows a user to input information about themselves. This information can then be communicated to the UserProfile using the following code: 
    // get information from external source (i.e. preferences dialog)
    int userId = preferenceDlg.getUserId();
    
    // using an AmazonInsights instance, call getUserProfile to get user profile
    AmazonInsights insightsInstance = AmazonInsights.newInstance(...);
    UserProfile userProfile = insightsInstance.getUserProfile();
    
    // set dimensions via UserProfile API
    userProfile.addDimensionAsNumber("user_id", userId)
               .addDimensionAsString("isUserDebug", String.valueOf(true));

You can set UserProfile dimensions from multiple threads; however, the synchronization of elements is not guaranteed. For example, when the SDK is allocating variations in thread 1, there might be 3 user dimensions defined. At the same time in thread 2, you add another dimension. The SDK cannot guarantee that the 4th dimension will be used when allocating variations in thread 1. To ensure that the correct dimensions are used, it is recommended that you set all user dimensions before allocating variations.

Once a user has been allocated a variation for a particular segment, the user will maintain the variation even if the dimensions change. For example, if yesterday a user received a variation that was targeted for debug accounts, and today they are no longer a debug account, the user will maintain the variation they received (even though they are no longer in the segment). Once a new experiment has been started, the current dimensions will be used to determine a brand new variation.
